title: Introduction into Ed25519
description: Ed25519 is a public-key digital signature cryptosystem proposed in 2011 by the team lead by Daniel J. Bernstein. It is a particular variant of EdDSA (Digital Signature Algorithm on twisted Edwards curves).

about.title: About the website
about.description: Technologies that made the website possible.

clamping.title: Why?
clamping.description: There are questions that are best left unanswered.

basics.title: Creating and verifying signatures
basics.description: As with other digital signature schemes, Ed25519 consists of three protocols: key generation, signing and verification. They are similar, but distinct, from the generic Schnorr scheme.

malleability.title: Malleable signatures
malleability.description: Now, the fun part begins: attempting to break Ed25519 in various ways. Our first approach is malleability, the ability to create digital signatures without the knowledge of the necessary secret key.

wildcards.title: Wildcard signatures
wildcards.description: One of the counter-intuitive feats of Ed25519 is that there are signatures matching any given message (or at least, a non-trivial fraction of messages, say, 1/8).

verification.title: Verification with public key only
verification.description: Verify a signature with knowledge of the public key only.
